note.p: Research Field: Organic, animal and agricultural chemistry
Education: Bonn; Paris (1822, with Thernard and Gay Lussac)
Career: Professor of Chemistry, Giessen (1824); Professor of Chemistry, Munich (1845); considered to be the founder of agricultural chemistry
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1875-1876 vol 24 pp xxvii-xxxvii
References: J S Rowlinson, 'An Entrepreneurial Chemist', review of W H Brock, Justus von Liebig: the Chemical Gatekeeper in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 374-375
N G Coley, 'Henry Bence-Jones, MD, FRS (1813-1873)' in NR 1973-4 vol 28 pp 31-56
R W Jones, 'Dalton's unfortunate choice' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 15-33
Notes: DSB gives death date as 18 April 1873
